Black Dragon"}]

EDIT: OH DUH… I see the problem… HP is set to zero. I thought the health was automatically set from the NPCDefinitions. Because that’s how the CFG file was. I was wondering because I saw the packet and there was nothing wrong with it. Haha sorry man. Thanks for helping. I just tried it and it works.

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

I don’t see anything for packet #72 though…

[CODE]
public void newNPC(int npcType, int x, int y, int heightLevel,
int WalkingType, int HP, int maxHit, int attack, int defence) {
// first, search for a free slot
int slot = -1;
for (int i = 1; i < maxNPCs; i++) {
if (npcs[i] == null) {
slot = i;
break;
}
}

	if (slot == -1)
		return; // no free slot found

	NPC newNPC = new NPC(slot, npcType);
	newNPC.absX = x;
	newNPC.absY = y;
	newNPC.makeX = x;
	newNPC.makeY = y;
	newNPC.heightLevel = heightLevel;
	newNPC.walkingType = WalkingType;
	newNPC.HP = HP;
	newNPC.MaxHP = HP;
	newNPC.maxHit = maxHit;
	newNPC.attack = attack;
	newNPC.defence = defence;
	npcs[slot] = newNPC;
}

public void newNPCList(int npcType, String npcName, int combat, int HP) {

	NPCDefinitions newNPCList = new NPCDefinitions(npcType);
	newNPCList.setNpcName(npcName);
	newNPCList.setNpcCombat(combat);
	newNPCList.setNpcHealth(HP);
	NPCDefinitions.getDefinitions()[npcType] = newNPCList;
}

[/CODE]

ATTACK_NPC = 72

if (NPCHandler.npcs[c.npcIndex].MaxHP == 0) { c.npcIndex = 0; break; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Freesunfury, post:42, topic:544760”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663638.msg4469634#msg4469634 date=1422260428]
OP’s updated :3
[/quote]

Can’t attack npcs. I can click any other npc and all the packets work correctly just not attacking npcs. What could be the cause?[/quote]
You might have some code that checks if the NPC’s hp is above 1 or not (Making them attackable…).

Look in the ClickNPC file for your ATTACK_NPC packet. Should be #72.

You’ll have something along the lines of:

if (NPCHandler.npcs[c.npcIndex].MaxHP == 0) { c.npcIndex = 0; break; }

That value might not be getting read/set right when parsing the npcs into your list… You need to check that it is.

Which would be in the newNpc method in your NPCHandler.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:39, topic:544760”]Are you loading the file before or AFTER the npcs are supposed to be spawned in game?

So is the NPCHandler initialized before the npcs are loaded, if so, move the NPCSpawns.loadNPCSpawns to your NPCHandler, above where you have the loadAutoSpawn. And you will need to make sure that you catch the exceptions it throws.[/quote]

Thanks I just fixed it and it works!

EDIT:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:39, topic:544760”]Are you loading the file before or AFTER the npcs are supposed to be spawned in game?

So is the NPCHandler initialized before the npcs are loaded, if so, move the NPCSpawns.loadNPCSpawns to your NPCHandler, above where you have the loadAutoSpawn. And you will need to make sure that you catch the exceptions it throws.[/quote]

I just noticed the walkType doesn’t work, the only one that works is Random and Default. How would I fix this?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Are you loading the file before or AFTER the npcs are supposed to be spawned in game?

So is the NPCHandler initialized before the npcs are loaded, if so, move the NPCSpawns.loadNPCSpawns to your NPCHandler, above where you have the loadAutoSpawn. And you will need to make sure that you catch the exceptions it throws.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Download v1.2 here

I updated the link with the latest version. And You will need a new NPCSpawns class which I have provided below:

[code=java]package server.model.npcs;

import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.JsonIOException;
import com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException;
import com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken;

/**

  • NPCSpawns, each represents a single npc spawn in the server which is held

  • within the array {@link #spawns}.

  • This was based off of Galkon’s ItemDefinitions, therefore it will be heavily

  • similar in a lot of ways.

  • @Author Jesse (Sk8rdude461)

  • @Author Galkon
    */
    public class NPCSpawns {

    /**

    • All the npc spawns.
      */
      private static ArrayList spawns;

    /**

    • The Id of the npc. Commonly referred to as npcType.
      */
      private int npcId;

    /**

    • The home x-pos to the npc
      */
      private int xPos;

    /**

    • The home y-pos to the npc
      */
      private int yPos;

    /**

    • The height level where the npc is spawned
      */
      private int height;

    /**

    • The Walking type for the npc.
      */
      private int walkType;

    /**

    • The health(Constitution) of the npc.
      */
      private int health;

    /**

    • The highest possible hit for the npc.
      */
      private int maxHit;

    /**

    • The attack level of the npc.
      */
      private int attack;

    /**

    • The defence level of the npc.
      */
      private int defence;

    /**

    • Extra info I added so you can tell where the npc is spawned.
      */
      private String name;

    public NPCSpawns(int npcid, int xPos, int yPos, int height, int walkType,
    int health, int maxHit, int attack, int defence, String name) {
    this.npcId = npcid;
    this.xPos = xPos;
    this.yPos = yPos;
    this.height = height;
    this.walkType = walkType;
    this.health = health;
    this.maxHit = maxHit;
    this.attack = attack;
    this.defence = defence;
    this.name = name;
    }

    public static NPCSpawns defaultNPC() {
    try {
    NPCSpawns npc = new NPCSpawns(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, “New NPC”);
    npc.setName(“New NPC”);
    System.out.println(“NPC Made!”);
    return npc;
    } catch (NullPointerException e) {
    return null;
    }
    }

    /**

    • Gets the npc spawns
    • @return spawns
      */
      public static ArrayList getNPCSpawns() {
      return spawns;
      }

    /**

    • Sets the npc spawns
    • @param npcSpawns
    •        the NPCSpawns to be set.

    */
    public static void setNPCSpawns(ArrayList npcSpawns) {
    NPCSpawns.spawns = npcSpawns;
    }

    /**

    • Loading the NPCSpawns.

    • @param file

    •        The file to be read

    • @throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      */
      public static void loadNPCSpawns() throws JsonIOException,
      JsonSyntaxException, FileNotFoundException {
      Gson gson = new Gson();
      long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
      System.out.println(“Loading NPC spawns…”);

      try (FileReader reader = new FileReader("./Data/cfg/npc-spawns.json")) {
      setNPCSpawns(gson.fromJson(reader,
      new TypeToken<ArrayList>() {
      }.getType()));
      } catch (IOException e) {
      System.out.println(“Failed to load NPC spawns!”);
      } finally {
      System.out.println("Loaded " + NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns().size()
      + " npc spawns in " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - start)
      + “ms.”);
      }

    }

    /**

    • @return npcId
      */
      public int getNpcId() {
      return npcId;
      }

    /**

    • @return xPos
      */
      public int getXPos() {
      return xPos;
      }

    /**

    • @return yPos
      */
      public int getYPos() {
      return yPos;
      }

    /**

    • @return height
      */
      public int getHeight() {
      return height;
      }

    /**

    • @return walkType
      */
      public int getWalkType() {
      return walkType;
      }

    /**

    • @return health
      */
      public int getHealth() {
      return health;
      }

    /**

    • @return maxHit
      */
      public int getMaxHit() {
      return maxHit;
      }

    /**

    • @return attack
      */
      public int getAttack() {
      return attack;
      }

    /**

    • @return defence
      */
      public int getDefence() {
      return defence;
      }

    /**

    • @return name
      */
      public String getName() {
      return name;
      }

    public void setNpcId(int npcId) {
    this.npcId = npcId;
    }

    public void setXPos(int xPos) {
    this.xPos = xPos;
    }

    public void setYPos(int yPos) {
    this.yPos = yPos;
    }

    public void setHeight(int height) {
    this.height = height;
    }

    public void setWalkType(int walkType) {
    this.walkType = walkType;
    }

    public void setHealth(int health) {
    this.health = health;
    }

    public void setMaxHit(int maxHit) {
    this.maxHit = maxHit;
    }

    public void setAttack(int attack) {
    this.attack = attack;
    }

    public void setDefence(int defence) {
    this.defence = defence;
    }

    public void setName(String name) {
    this.name = name;
    }
    }[/code]

And your new JSON file:

[ { "npcId":0, "xPos":0, "yPos":0, "height":0, "walkType":0, "health":0, "maxHit":0, "attack":0, "defence":0, "name":"New NPC" }, { "npcId":0, "xPos":0, "yPos":0, "height":0, "walkType":0, "health":0, "maxHit":0, "attack":0, "defence":0, "name":"New NPC2" } ]

Some notable changes to the Editor:

[ul][li]Disabled “pretty” printing in the JSON file, for increased compression[/li]
[li]Converted NPCSpawns spawns into an ArrayList from an array[/li]
[li]Rewrote saving for efficiency.[/li][/ul]

I’ll update the OP whenever I can.

Edit:

This may help…

public boolean loadAutoSpawn() { try { for(int i = 0; i < NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns().size(); i++) { NPCSpawns npc = NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns().get(i); newNPC(npc.getNpcId(), npc.getXPos(), npc.getYPos(),npc.getHeight(), npc.getWalkType(), npc.getHealth(), npc.getMaxHit(), npc.getAttack(), npc.getDefence()); } return true; } catch(Exception e) { return false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:31, topic:544760”]Yeah, when I wrote the editor I used the wrong data format and I never got to fixing it…
I used an array and I should have used an ArrayList…
If I still have the project I’ll go in and update the code, but that will mean there’s going to be some modifications to the NPCSpawns class and the JSON file.

I assume when you load the file it tells you X spawns loaded in Y time and doesn’t give an error?

edit: I also won’t be able to update the OP till I get a mod to reset the timer. So that has to wait.[/quote]

[CODE]
[Console]: Control Panel disabled.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded: ObjectDef configuration.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded: Region configuration.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded: 2677895 clipped tiles.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded: 1019 doors in 70ms.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded: 273 double doors in 15ms.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loading NPC spawns…
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Loaded 3 npc spawns in 2ms.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: Initiated In: 4560 ms.
[1/25/15 2:33 AM]: SunScape Beta: ONLINE 43594

[/CODE]

Ok yeah if you can do that for me that would be great. I’ve been looking for GSON forever. Yeah it does

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

Yes… Can you add me on Skype if you have I really would like to use this. SunnyPlusPlus
In server.java I have under public static void main(java.lang.String args[])
throws NullPointerException, IOException {

NPCSpawns.loadNPCSpawns();

NPCHandler

[CODE]
public NPCHandler() {
for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i++) {
npcs[i] = null;
NPCDefinitions.getDefinitions()[i] = null;
}

	loadNPCList("./Data/CFG/npc.cfg");
	loadAutoSpawn();
}

[/CODE]

public boolean loadAutoSpawn() { try { for(int i = 0; i < NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns().length; i++) { newNPC(NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getNpcId(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getXPos(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getYPos(),NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getHeight(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getWalkType(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getHealth(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getMaxHit(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getAttack(), NPCSpawns.getNPCSpawns()[i].getDefence()); } return true; } catch(Exception e) { return false; } }

Oh also when you use the spawn editor you can’t hit new npc, it will just overwrite the one you are on…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI/wL] NPC Spawns from json [v1.3]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ve decided to release my Editor for this as well.

Download now!
Pic:

How to use:

Well it’s very straightforward. Afaik.
Open the file using either the menu or hitting CTRL + O. Then pick an npc from the list, edit whatever you want. Hit CTRL + W to save the NPC, or press the button.
To save the file, hit CTRL + S or click the option in the menu. Pressing help will take you to this topic.
To remove an NPC, select it from the list and press delete or backspace (on your keyboard). It’ll confirm your action, and upon hitting yes, will delete.

Hope this helps.
